description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣

**English II for Non-English Majors**

Spring 2019

INSTRUCTOR  

Ann Wan-Hsin Lee 李婉歆, ptm104\_8774@ntnu.edu.tw

COURSE DESCRIPTION

This course aims to develop student’s English proficiency regarding all four language skills. Students are expected to increase their reading and writing literacy along with listening comprehension and communication competence through a variety of in-class and out-of-class activities.

COURSE MATERIAL

Paul Dummet, Helen Stephenson, Lewis Lansford. (2017). _Keynote 3._ National Geographic Learning.

LEXILE (We will have book sharing events when you turn in journals)

*   You are very encouraged to read the book at your own pace, according to your own schedule.

Journal 1: Your schedule for reading this book

*   How many chapters do you plan to read in this semester?
*   How do you plan to read the book?

(for example, one chapter a week, a month)

*   How do you plan to use the book to improve your English?
*   Is there any other material related to the book (movies, cartoons, comics)?

       Journal 2: The difficulties you have faced so far

       Journal 3: The achievement you have made

*   How much have you read?
*   How do you like the book?
*   What have you learned from the book?
*   How are you going to finish the rest of the book?

BOOK FLYER (Individual Project, English only)

*   Imagine that you work for a publishing company. You have to promote the book with a flyer. How are you going to introduce the book in two pages?

MOVIE SCRIPT PRESENTATION (Pair Project, English-Only),

You need to have

1.  a short clip of a movie you want to introduce
2.  a brief introduction about what the movie is about
3.  a handout with the script

*   an activity (either before the video or after the presentation)
*   useful expressions in conversation (NOT vocabulary, NOT patterns).
